description: An Amazon Web Services Verified Access instance is a regional entity that evaluates application requests and grants access only when your security requirements are met.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the Verified Access instance. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure idempotency of your modification request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessInstance
nested_items.description: Details about the Verified Access instance.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessInstanceId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Verified Access instance.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: A description for the Amazon Web Services Verified Access instance.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessTrustProviders
nested_items.description: The IDs of the Amazon Web Services Verified Access trust providers.

nested_items.name: VerifiedAccessTrustProviderId
nested_items.description: The ID of the trust provider.

nested_items.name: TrustProviderType
nested_items.description: The type of trust provider (user- or device-based).

nested_items.name: UserTrustProviderType
nested_items.description: The type of user-based trust provider.

nested_items.name: DeviceTrustProviderType
nested_items.description: The type of device-based trust provider.

nested_items.name: FipsEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether support for Federal Information Processing Standards (FIPS) is enabled on the instance.
